subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The PayPal Mafia: One Company, Dozens of Empires
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The PayPal Mafia: One Company, Dozens of Empires.

hook.text: PayPal's early team went on to create Tesla, LinkedIn, YouTube, Palantir, Yelp, and SpaceX.

buildup.text: PayPal was forged in the brutal dotcom era. The team learned to move fast, fight hard, and think big.

discovery.text: The 'PayPal Mafia' succeeded because the culture selected for ambition, speed, and contrarian thinking.

twist.text: Many of them competed against each other. Competition among allies sharpened everyone's game.

climax.text: Companies founded by PayPal alumni are worth over $1 trillion combined.

punchline.text: The right team in the right crucible creates legends.

quiz.question: Why did so many successful companies emerge from PayPal's early team?
options: The intense culture selected for ambitious, fast-moving, contrarian thinkers
PayPal gave each employee startup funding when they left
They all worked in the same industry after PayPal
